member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.AP1099Box
member.summary: Represents a type of 1099 payment, which generally corresponds to a box on the 1099-MISC form. This DAC is used by Acumatica ERP to track 1099-related payments. 1099 boxes are configured through the AP Preferences screen (AP.10.10.00).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.AP1099Box.BoxNbr

member.summary: The minimum payment amount for the 1099 type to be included for reporting.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.Standalone.APRegisterAlias
member.summary: An alias descendant version of . Can be used e.g. to avoid behaviour when substitutes for derived classes. Can also be used as a table alias if is joined multiple times in BQL.
member.remarks: Contains all BQL fields from the base class, which is enforced by unit tests. This class should NOT override any properties. If you need such behaviour, derive from this class, do not alter it.

member.summary: [key] Reference number of the document.

member.summary: The date when payment for the document is due in accordance with the credit terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.DiscDate
member.summary: The date when the cash discount can be taken in accordance with the credit terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.InvoiceDate
member.summary: The documentâ€™s original date as assigned by the vendor (for informational purposes).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.TaxZoneID
member.summary: Identifier of the tax zone associated with the document. Defaults to vendor's tax zone.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryTaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of taxes associated with the document. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.TaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of taxes associated with the document. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryLineTotal
member.summary: The document total presented in the currency of the document. (See )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.LineTotal
member.summary: The document total presented in the base currency of the company. (See )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryVatExemptTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are marked as exempt and are neither statistical nor reverse. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.VatExemptTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are marked as exempt and are neither statistical nor reverse. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryVatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total, which is subject to VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are neither exempt, nor statistical, nor reverse. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.VatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total, which is subject to VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are neither exempt, nor statistical, nor reverse. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.DrCr
member.summary: Read-only field indicating whether the document is of debit or credit type. The value of this field is based solely on the field.
member.value: Possible values are "D" (for Invoice, Credit Adjustment, Prepayment, Quick Check) and "C" (for Debit Adjustment and Void Quick Check).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.SeparateCheck
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document should be paid for by a separate check. In other words, the payment to such a document must not be consolidated with other payments.
member.value: Defaults to the value of the same setting for vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PaySel
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document is approved for payment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayLocationID
member.summary: location for payment.
member.value: Defaults to vendor's default location or to the first active location of the vendor if the former is not set.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayDate
member.summary: The date when the bill has been approved for payment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayTypeID
member.summary: The payment method used for the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the PaymentMethod.PaymentMethodID field. Defaults to the payment method associated with the vendor location.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayAccountID
member.summary: The cash account used for the payment.
member.value: Defaults to the cash account associated with the selected location and payment method. In case such account is not found the default value will be the cash account which is specified as default for AP for the selected payment method.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PrebookAcctID
member.summary: The expense account used to record the expenses pending reclassification. The field is relevant only if the Support for Expense Reclassification feature is activated and the document has or has had the Prebooked ("K") status. (See )
member.value: Defaults to the account associated with the vendor of the document. Corresponds to the AccountID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PrebookSubID
member.summary: The subaccount used to record the expenses pending reclassification. The field is relevant only if the Support for Expense Reclassification feature is activated and the document has or has had the Prebooked ("K") status. (See )
member.value: Defaults to the subaccount associated with the vendor of the document. Corresponds to the AccountID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.EstPayDate
member.summary: Estimated payment date.
member.value: The field is calculated and equals either if the document is selected for payment or the otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.LCEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether landed cost is enabled for the document.
member.value: Equals true if the vendor of the document is a Landed Cost vendor and the document has landed cost associated with it.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.IsTaxDocument
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the document is tax bill and orginally has been created by tax reporting process.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.DocType
member.summary: [key] Type of the document.
member.value: Possible values are: "CHK" - Check, "ADR" - Debit Adjustment, "PPM" - Prepayment, "REF" - Refund, "VCK" - Void Check

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.RefNbr
member.summary: [key] Reference number of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.RemitAddressID
member.summary: Remittance address for the document.
member.value: Defaults to the remittance address of the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.RemitContactID

member.value: Defaults to the remittance contact of the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.BranchID

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.ExtRefNbr

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.AdjDate

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.AdjFinPeriodID

member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field, but can be overriden manually.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.ImpRefNbr

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.IsTaxValid
member.summary: When true, indicates that the amount of tax calculated with the external Tax Engine(Avalara) is up to date. If this field equals false, the document was updated since last synchronization with the Tax Engine and taxes might need recalculation.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.IsTaxPosted

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.IsTaxSaved

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup
member.summary: Allows to configure the Accounts Payable module. Some of the settings, such as numbering sequences, cannot be changed once the module is in use.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.BatchNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for batches generated by the Accounts Payable module.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.DfltVendorClassID
member.summary: The vendor class to be used as the default vendor class. When a new vendor class is created using the Vendor Classes (AP.20.10.00) form, the settings defined for the class specified here will be inserted into the appropriate boxes.
member.value: Refers the DAC.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PerRetainTran
member.summary: Defines the number of periods, during which the batches generated by the Accounts Payable module will be stored in the database. Increasing this value later, after some period of use, is not recommended, because the history deleted from the database cannot be restored and some reports will be incomplete.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PerRetainHist
member.summary: Defines the number of periods, during which the Accounts Payable module history will be stored in the database. Increasing this value later, after some period of use, is not recommended, because the history deleted from the database cannot be restored and some reports will be incomplete.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.InvoiceNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for Accounts Payable bills.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PastDue00
member.summary: The maximum number of days outstanding or past due for the document to be included in the first category.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PastDue01
member.summary: The maximum number of days outstanding or past due for the document to be included in the second category. If the value here is greater than the PastDue00 value, documents from the first category are not included in the second category.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PastDue02
member.summary: The maximum number of days outstanding or past due for the document to be included in the third category. If the value here is greater than the PastDue01 value, documents from the second category are not included in the third category.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.CheckNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for Accounts Payable payments.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.CreditAdjNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for credit adjustments.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.DebitAdjNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for debit adjustments.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.DefaultTranDesc
member.summary: Default way to populate description for new transactions.
member.value: "C" - Combination of Vendor ID and Name, "I" - Vendor ID, "N" - Vendor Name, "U" - description entered by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.ExpenseSubMask
member.summary: The subaccount mask that defines the rule of choosing segment values for the expense subaccount to be used for non-stock items on data entry forms in the Accounts Payable module. To set up the rule, select a segment, press F3, and choose a source of the segment value, which is one of the following options:
member.value: The mask may include the following characters: C: Expense subaccount associated with branch E: Subaccount associated with employee I: Subaccount associated with non-stock item L: Subaccount associated with vendor location For a segment, the characters designating each option are repeated as many times as there are characters in the segment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.AutoPost
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that transactions will be automatically posted to the General Ledger once they are released in the Accounts Payable module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.TransactionPosting
member.summary: Indicates whether to post transactions to GL as summary or in detailed mode. Is set by the field.
member.value: "S" - Summary, "D" - Detail. Defaults to Detail.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.SummaryPost
member.summary: Indicates whether to post transactions to GL as summary or in detailed mode. This field depends on and changes field when set.
member.value: true indicates that summary should be posted (corresponds to "S" value of the field.)

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RequireApprovePayments
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that approval of bills is required before bills may be paid. Bills can be approved using the Approve Bills for Payment (AP.50.20.00) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RequireControlTotal
member.summary: If set to true, adds the Amount box to the Summary area of the Bills and Adjustments (AP.30.10.00) form. To save a document in the Balanced status, the user must enter the document total in this box after reviewing the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.HoldEntry
member.summary: If set to true, new documents will have the On Hold status by default, which prevents them from being released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.EarlyChecks
member.summary: If set to true, allows to enter and print checks for bills, belonging to future periods.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RequireVendorRef
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that users must fill in Vendor Ref. () on data entry forms in the Accounts Payable, Taxes and Purchase Orders modules. Also this check box controls the Ext. Ref. Number box (GLTranDoc.ExtRefNbr) on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form of the General Ledger module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PaymentLeadTime
member.summary: The number of days on average required for a payment to reach a vendor location. This value is used as a default value for multiple boxes on the Approve Bills for Payment (AP.50.20.00) and Prepare Payments (AP.50.30.00) forms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.InvoicePrecision
member.summary: Determines the smallest value to round bills amount to. Doesn't have any effect unless Invoice Rounding feature is enabled. If Rounding Rule () is set to Use Currency Precision ("N") the value of this field similarly does not affect rounding.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.InvoiceRounding
member.summary: Determines the rule to be used to round bills total amounts. Doesn't have any effect unless Invoice Rounding feature is enabled. Smallest unit to round to is determined by the precision of the Currency if Use Currency Precision is selected, or by the value of the field otherwise.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Use Currency Precision: To round the totals to the decimal precision supported by the currency of the document. (See Currency.DecimalPlaces field.) "R" - Nearest: To round each bill total to the nearest multiple of the smallest unit (specified in the Rounding Precision box). (Mathematical rounding) "C" - Up: To round up each bill total to the next multiple of the smallest unit. "F" - Down: To round down each bill total to the previous multiple of the smallest unit.

member.summary:
Provides a selector for the Inventory Items, which may be put into the AP Invoice line
The list is filtered by the user access rights and Inventory Item status - inactive

May be used only on DAC derived from APTran.
[APTranInventoryItem(Filterable = true)]

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.PaymentRefAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute implements auto-generation of the next check sequential number for APPayment Document
according to the settings in the CashAccount and PaymentMethod.
It's also creates and inserts a related record into the CashAccountCheck table
and keeps it in synch. with AP Payment (delets it if the the payment is deleted.
Depends upon CashAccountID, PaymentMethodID, StubCntr fields of the row.
Cache(s) for the CashAccountCheck must be present in the graph

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.PaymentRefAttribute.UpdateCashManager
member.summary:
This flag defines wether the field is defaulted from the PaymentMethodAccount record by the next check number
If it set to false - the field on which attribute is set will not be initialized by the next value.
This flag doesn't affect persisting behavior - if user enter next number manually, it will be saved.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.PaymentRefAttribute.Table
member.summary:
Defines a table, from where oldValue of the field is taken from.
If not set - the table associated with the sender will be used

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APQuickCheckTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for APQuickCheck version of the APTaxAttribute(override).
Provides Tax calculation for APTran, by default is attached to APTran (details) and APQuickCheck (header)
Normally, should be placed on the TaxCategoryID field.
Internally, it uses APQuickCheckEntry graph, otherwise taxes are not calculated (tax calc Level is set to NoCalc).
As a result of this attribute work a set of APTax tran related to each AP Tran and to their parent will created
May be combined with other attrbibutes with similar type - for example, APTaxAttribute
[APQuickCheckTax(typeof(Standalone.APQuickCheck), typeof(APTax), typeof(APTaxTran))]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.AP.APQuickCheckTaxAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Type,System.Type)

Type of the TaxTran recorde for the main documect (summary). Must be iBqlTable

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for AP version of the TaxAttribute.
Provides Tax calculation for APTran, by default is attached to APTran (details) and APInvoice (header)
Normally, should be placed on the TaxCategoryID field.
Internally, it uses APInvoiceEntry graphs, otherwise taxes are not calculated (tax calc Level is set to NoCalc).
As a result of this attribute work a set of APTax tran related to each AP Tran and to their parent will created
May be combined with other attrbibutes with similar type - for example, APTaxAttribute
[APTax(typeof(APRegister), typeof(APTax), typeof(APTaxTran))]

member.summary: Static function for release of AP documents and posting of the released batch. Released batches will be posted if the corresponded flag in APSetup is set to true. member.name: M:PX.Objects.PO.POReceiptTaxAttribute.RowUpdated(PX.Data.PXCache,PX.Data.PXRowUpdatedEventArgs)
member.summary: The purpose of this handler is to workaround situations where exception was thrown in RowUpdated event chain and formulas that are embedded inside SOTaxAttribute will fail to calculate totals. Resetting totals to null will force formulas to calculate on all the details rather then calculate on the difference from previous incorrect result.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.POLineInventoryItemAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for POLine version of the CrossItemAttribute.
Providing an Inventory ID selector for the field, it allows also user
to select both InventoryID and SubItemID by typing AlternateID in the control
As a result, if user type a correct Alternate id, values for InventoryID, SubItemID,
and AlternateID fields in the row will be set.
In this attribute, InventoryItems with a status inactive, markedForDeletion,
noPurchase and noRequest are filtered out. It also fixes INPrimaryAlternateType parameter to VPN
This attribute may be used in combination with AlternativeItemAttribute on the AlternateID field of the row
[POLineInventoryItem(Filterable = true)]

Static function for release of AR documents and posting of the released batch. Released batches will be posted if the corresponded flag in ARSetup is set to true. SkipPost parameter is used to override this flag. This function can not be called from inside of the covering DB transaction scope, unless skipPost is set to true.
member.param: List of the documents to be released
Flag specifing if the function is called from mass process - affects error handling
List of batches that should not be posted inside the release procedure
Delegate to be called if release process completed successfully
Delegate to be called inside the transaction scope of AR document release process

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoiceNbrAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for ARInvoice version of the InvoiceNbrAttribute.
The main purpose of the attribute is poviding of the uniqueness of the RefNbr
amoung a set of documents of the specifyed types (for example, each RefNbr of the ARInvoice
the ARInvoices must be unique across all ARInvoices and AR Debit memos)
This may be useful, if user has configured a manual numberin for ARInvoices
or needs to create ARInvoice from another document (like SOOrder) allowing to type RefNbr
for the to-be-created Invoice manually. To store the numbers, system using ARInvoiceNbr table,
keyed uniquelly by DocType and RefNbr. A source document is linked to a number by NoteID.
Attributes checks a number for uniqueness on FieldVerifying and RowPersisting events.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.CustomerRawAttribute
member.summary:
Provides a UI Selector for Customers AcctCD as a string.
Should be used where the definition of the AccountCD is needed - mostly, in a Customer DAC class.
Properties of the selector - mask, length of the key, etc.
are defined in the Dimension with predefined name "CUSTOMER".
By default, search uses the following tables (linked) BAccount, Customer (strict), Contact, Address (optional).
List of the Customers is filtered based on the user's access rights.
Default column's list in the Selector - Customer.acctCD, Customer.acctName,
Customer.customerClassID, Customer.status, Contact.phone1, Address.city, Address.countryID, Contact.EMail
List of properties - inherited from AcctSubAttribute
[CustomerRaw(IsKey = true)]

and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in AR Setup and ARInvoice types:
namely ARSetup.invoiceNumberingID - for ARInvoice, ARSetup.adjustmentNumberingID - for ARDebitMemo and ARCreditMemo
ARSetup.finChargeNumberingID - for FinCharges
ARSetup.paymentNumberingID - for CashSale and CashReturn

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice
member.summary: Represents the Accounts Receivable invoices, credit and debit memos, overdue charges and credit write-offs as well as the invoices created in the Sales Orders module (see ). The records of this type are created and edited through the Invoices and Memos (AR.30.10.00) screen (corresponds to the graph). The SO Invoices are created and edited through the Invoices (SO.30.30.00) screen (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier
member.summary: Represents a Carrier used by the company for shipping goods or a company's own shipping option. The records of this type are created and edited through the Ship Via Codes (CS.20.75.00) screen (Corresponds to the graph). If the feature is enabled, the corresponding settings and plugins are defined through the Carriers (CS.20.77.00) screen (Corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CarrierID
member.summary: Key field. A unique code of a non-integrated carrier, a method of the integrated carrier or a shipping option of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CalcMethod
member.summary: The method used to calculate freight charges using the rate breakdown specified in the related records.
member.value: Allowed values are: "P" - Per Unit, "N" - Net (flat rates), "M" - Manual. Defaults to Manual ("M").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.Description
member.summary: The description of the carrier or shipping option.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the Tax Category to be applied to the freight amount when goods are shipped with this shipping option.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CalendarID
member.summary: The Calendar associated with the carrier, which reflects its work hours and the days when it ships the goods.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightSalesAcctID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger income , that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightSalesSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger Subaccount, that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightExpenseAcctID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger expense , that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the Carrier.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightExpenseSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger Subaccount, that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the Carrier.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.BaseRate
member.summary: The flat-rate charge, which is added to the freight amount calculated according to the related records. This field is relevan only if is set to false.
member.value: Defaults to 0.0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.IsExternal
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must use a plugin, specified in the field, to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if the feature is enabled.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CarrierPluginID
member.summary: Identifier of the used to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.PluginMethod
member.summary: The code of the Service Method of the Carrier Plugin that is used to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.ConfirmationRequired
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that to confirm the shipment the system will require confirmation for each package used for shipment with this shipment option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.PackageRequired
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that at least one package must be specified to create (and confirm) a shipment with this shipment option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.IsCommonCarrier
member.summary: Indicates whether the carrier is a common carrier. Because common carriers deliver goods from a company branch to the customer location that is a selling point, the value of this field affects the set of taxes that applies to the corresponding invoice.
member.value: When set to true, the carrier is considered common and hence the taxes from the customer's tax zone are applied. Otherwise, the system applies the taxes from the taz zone associated with the selling branch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.summary: The unique identifier of the FOB Point.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.FOBPoint.Description

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CS.Terms
member.summary: Represents Credit Terms used for Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable documents. The records of this type are created and edited through the Credit Terms (CS.20.65.00) (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.TermsID
member.summary: Key field. Unique identifier of the Credit Terms record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.Descr
member.summary: The description of the Credit Terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.VisibleTo
member.summary: Determines the categories of Business Accounts, for whom these terms can be used.
member.value: Allowed values are: "AL" - All, "VE" - Vendors only, "CU" - Customers only, "DS" - Disabled (can't be selected for Business Accounts or documents of any module). Defaults to "AL" - All.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DueType
member.summary: Determines the way the Due Date is calucalated for documents under these Terms.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Fixed Number of Days, "D" - Day of Next Month, "E" - End of Month, "M" - End of Next Month, "T" - Day of the Month, "P" - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month, "C" - Custom. Defaults to "N" - Fixed Number of Days.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDue00
member.summary: Defines the first Due Date for the terms. The meaning of this field varies depending on the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayFrom00
member.summary: The start day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the first due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayTo00
member.summary: The end day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the first due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDue01
member.summary: The second Due Date used with Custom ("C") (see and ). Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayFrom01
member.summary: The start day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the second due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayTo01
member.summary: The end day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the second due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DiscType
member.summary: Defines how the system determines whether Cash Discount is applicable for a document under these Terms on a particular date .
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Fixed Number of Days, "D" - Day of Next Month, "E" - End of Month, "M" - End of Next Month, "T" - Day of the Month, "P" - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month. Defaults to Fixed Number of Days ("N").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDisc
member.summary: The number of days or a particular day of the month (depending on the value of ), during/before which the Cash Discount is applicable for the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DiscPercent
member.summary: The percent of the Cash Discount under these Terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentType
member.summary: The type of installment.
member.value: Allowed values are: "S" - Single, "M" - Multiple. Defaults to Single ("S").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentCntr
member.summary: The number of Installments for these Terms. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentFreq
member.summary: The frequency of Installments for these Terms. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M") and the is not Split by Percents in Table ("S").
member.value: Allowed values are: "W" - Weekly, "M" - Monthly, "B" - Semi-monthly (the second installment comes a half a month after the first one, and so on).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentMthd
member.summary: The method, according to which the amounts of installments are calculated. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M").
member.value: Allowed values are: "E" - Equal Parts, "A" - All Tax in First Installment (the total amount before tax is split equally between installments and the entire amount of tax is added to the first installment), "S" - Split by Percents in Table (the days and amounts of installments are defined by the related records).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMAccountGroup
member.summary: Account Group that is used in the Project Module. Group of GL accounts of the same type. Every GL Account can be included into one and only one group of the same type as the account (Asset, Liability, Income and Expense). It is also possible to create non accounting GL Group, that can be used for collection and trace of any statistical information on the project that is not related to finance. Account groups are used to classify project budget and balance information. Essentially in the scope of project they play the same role as the GL account in terms of GL Ledger. Account groups are mapped to GL accounts to provide transfer and mapping of the project related financial information from the GL module to Project Management Module. Account groups are not mapped to GL accounts one to one to reduce the number of the account groups compare to the number of the natural GL accounts. The other reason is the ability to create non - financial account groups to enter and analyze the information that is not directly linked to finance.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ActiveProjectAttribute
member.summary: Project Selector that displays only Active and Not Completed Projects

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ActiveProjectForModuleAttribute
member.summary: Project Selector that displays only Active Projects for a given Module. Project Field is visible and mandatory only if the Current module (XX) is integrated into PM. i.e. PMSetup.VisibleInXX = True. If Customer field is supplied then only those Projects are shown that are specific for the given Customer. ShowContracts option specifies whether to show Contracts in the selector or just Projects.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ActiveProjectOrContractAttribute
member.summary: Project Selector that displays only Active Projects and Active Contracts for the given Customer. If Customer is null all Active Projects and Contracts are displayed.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.POActiveProjectAttribute
member.summary: Displays only Active Projects. Project Field is visible only if the PO module is integrated into PM. i.e. PMSetup.VisibleInPO = True. If Visible, Project field is mandatory only for non-stock type of lines (Non-stock, service, freight)

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectTaskAttribute
member.summary: Displays all Tasks for the given Project. Task is mandatory if Project is set.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectTaskAttribute.AllowNullIfContract
member.summary: If True allows TaskID to be null if ProjectID is a Contract.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectTaskRawAttribute
member.summary: Attribute for TaskCD field. Aggregates PXFieldAttribute, PXUIFieldAttribute and DimensionSelector without any restriction.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ActiveProjectTaskAttribute
member.summary: Task Selector that displays all active Tasks for the given Project. Task Field is Disabled if a Non-Project is selected; otherwise mandatory. Task Selector always work in pair with Project Selector. When the Project Selector displays a valid Project Task field becomes mandatory. When This selector is used in pair with and a Contract is selected Task is no longer mandatory. If Completed Task is selected an error will be displayed - Completed Task cannot be used in DataEntry.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.SOFreightDetailTask
member.summary:
Task Selector that displays all active Tasks for the given Project. Task Field is Disabled if a Non-Project is selected; otherwise mandatory. Task Selector always work in pair with Project Selector. When the Project Selector displays a valid Project Task field becomes mandatory. If Completed Task is selected an error will be displayed - Completed Task cannot be used in DataEntry.
Task is mandatory only if the Freight amount is greater then zero.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Defaults ProjectID to the Non-Project if the module supplied is either null or not not intergated with Project Management i.e. PMSetup.VisibleInXX = False. When Search is supplied ProjectID is defaulted with the value returned by that search. Selector also contains static Util methods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectDefaultAttribute.ForceProjectExplicitly

member.name: P:PX.Objects.RUTROT.ARInvoiceRUTROT.IsRUTROTDeductible
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document is subjected to ROT and RUT deductions. This field is relevant only if the ROT and RUT Deduction feature is enabled, the value of the field is true for the Branch of the document and the document is an invoice (see ).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.RUTROT.BranchRUTROT.AllowsRUTROT
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the Branch allows for ROT and RUT deduction. This, in turn, allows to mark the lines of AR invoices as RUT and ROT deductible. This field is relevant only if the ROT and RUT Deduction feature has been activated.

member.summary: The maximum amount of RUT and ROT deduction allowed for the document. This field is relevant only if is true. Given in the currency of the document.

member.summary: The amount of RUT and ROT deductions that has been distributed between the household members. This field is relevant only if is true. Given in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.RUTROT.RUTROT.DistributedAmt

For the lines used to create AP or AR documents the account is selected automatically once the vendor or customer is chosen. For CA transactions the account is either entered by user (for Disbursements) or selected automatically based on the Entry Type (for Receipts). Corresponds to the field.

member.summary:
Specilaized for GL.BatchModule version of the
It defines how the new numbers are generated for the GL Batch.
References Batch.module and Batch.dateEntered fields of the document,
and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in GLSetup (namely GLSetup.batchNumberingID)
and CADeposit:

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.BatchModule.PMListAttribute
member.summary: List of Modules supported in Project Management

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.Batch
member.summary: Represents a batch of journal transactions. The records of this type are edited through the Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen (corresponds to the graph). GL batches are also created whenever a document that needs posting to GL is released in any other module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the record is selected for mass processing.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BranchID
member.summary: Identifier of the , to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Module
member.summary: Key field. The code of the module, to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Allowed values are: "GL", "AP", "AR", "CM", "CA", "IN", "DR", "FA", "PM", "TX", "SO", "PO".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BatchNbr
member.summary: Key field. Auto-generated unique number of the batch.
member.value: The number is generated from the Numbering Sequence specified in the setup record of the , to which the batch belongs. For example, the numbering sequence for the batches belonging to the General Ledger module is specified in the field. For other modules see corresponding setup DACs.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.LedgerID
member.summary: Identifier of the , to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.DateEntered
member.summary: The date of the batch, specified by user.
member.value: Defaults to the current Business Date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.FinPeriodID
member.summary: Identifier of the Financial Period, to which the batch belongs.
member.value: By default the period is deducted from the date of the batch. Can be overriden by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BatchType
member.summary: The type of the batch.
member.value: Allowed values are: "H" - Normal, "R" - Recurring, "C" - Consolidation, "T" - Trial Balance, "RCL" - Reclassification, "A" - Allocation. Defaults to "H" - Normal.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.NumberCode
member.summary: The identifier of the record used to assign an auto-generated to the batch.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The number codes are assigned by the and graphs, which allows to have separate numbering sequences for recurring and allocation batches.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.RefNbr
member.summary: Auto-generated reference number assigned to the batch according to the Numbering Sequence specified in the field of the corresponding record (see the field).
member.value: The field will remain empty if is not set for the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Status
member.summary: The read-only status of the batch.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the , , , and fields. Possible values are: "H" - Hold "B" - Balanced "U" - Unposted "P" - Posted "C" - Completed "V" - Voided "R" - Released "Q" - Partially Released "S" - Scheduled

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryDebitTotal
member.summary: The total debit amount of the batch in its currency.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryCreditTotal
member.summary: The total credit amount of the batch in its currency.
member.value: See also .

members.member:
The control total of the batch in its currency.
See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.DebitTotal
member.summary: The total debit amount of the batch in the base currency of the company.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CreditTotal
member.summary: The total credit amount of the batch in the base currency of the company.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ControlTotal
member.summary: The control total of the batch in the base currency of the company.
member.value: See also .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryInfoID
member.summary: Identifier of the CurrencyInfo record associated with the batch.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.AutoReverse
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the batch is auto-reversing. For a batch of this kind the system automatically generates a reversing batch in the next period. The reversing batch is generated either when the original batch is posted or when it is released, depending on the value of the field of the GL preferences record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.AutoReverseCopy
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the batch is a reversing batch. See also the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.OrigModule
member.summary: The module, to which the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by this batch) belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.OrigBatchNbr
member.summary: The number of the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by this batch).
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Released
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Posted
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been posted.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Draft
member.summary: When set to true, indicates the the batch is a draft. The drafts of batches are not displayed in the Journal Transactions screen.
member.value: This field is set to true by the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) screen ( graph) when a new defining a transactions batch is created. This allows to reserve a number for the batch, while not showing it in the interface until the is released and the batch is actually created. Outside Journal Vouchers defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.TranPeriodID
member.summary: Identifier of the Financial Period of the batch.
member.value: Determined by the date of the batch. Unlike the field, the value of this field can't be overriden by user and always reflects the period corresponding to the date of the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.LineCntr
member.summary: The counter of the document lines, used internally to assign consistent numbers to newly created lines. It is not recommended to rely on this field to determine the exact count of lines, because it might not reflect the latter under some conditions.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryID
member.summary: The code of the Currency of the batch.
member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ScheduleID
member.summary: Identifier of the , associated with the batch.
member.value: If is true for the batch, then this field provides the identifier of the schedule, into which the batch is included as a template. Otherwise, the field is set to the identifier of the schedule that produced the batch. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Hold
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch is on hold.
member.value: Defaults to true, if the flag is set in the preferences of the module, and to false otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Scheduled
member.summary: When true, indicates that the batch is included as a template into a pointed to by the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Voided
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been voided.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Description
member.summary: The description of the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CreateTaxTrans
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must generate tax transactions for the batch.
member.value: This field is taken into account only if the feature is on. Affects only those batches, which belong to the General Ledger . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.SkipTaxValidation
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system should not validate the tax transactions associated with the batch.
member.value: The value of this field is relevant only if is true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ReverseCount
member.summary: The read-only field, reflecting the number of batches in the system, which reverse this batch.
member.value: This field is populated only by the graph (corresponds to the Journal Transactions GL.30.10.00 screen).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.Company
member.summary: Provides access to the settings of the company. The information related to the company is edited through the Branches (CS.10.20.00) screen (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Company.CompanyCD
member.summary: Unique user-friendly identifier of the Company.
member.value: Corresponds to the field of the associated Business Account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Company.BaseCuryID
member.summary: The base of the company.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Company.PhoneMask
member.summary: The mask used to display phone numbers for all branches of the company.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup
member.summary: Provides access to the preferences of the General Ledger module. Can be edited by user through the General Ledger Preferences (GL.10.20.00) screen.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.YtdNetIncAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the Year-to-Date Net Income . The account tracks net income accumulated since the beginning of the financial year. It is updated by every transaction posted in the system. The account must not be changed after any journal transactions have been posted.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Only Accounts of type Liability ("L") can be specified as YTD Net Income account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RetEarnAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the Retained Earnings . The account is updated by the amount accumulated on the YTD Net Income account during the financial year closing.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoRevOption
member.summary: Determines when the system generates reversing batches.
member.value: Possible values are: "P" - On Post and "C" - On Period Closing. Default value is On Post.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoRevEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system creates negative entries when reversing a . If set to true, the transactions of the reversing batch will retain the Debit/Credit amounts of the original transactions, but with opposite signs. If set to false, the transactions of the reversing batch will retain the sign of the original amounts, but will have them on the opposite sides of Debit/Credit.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoPostOption
member.summary: Determines whether the system must automatically post Batches once they are released. When this option is set to true there won't be any batches with status Unposted in the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.COAOrder
member.summary: Determines the order of Accounts in the reports of the General Ledger module.
member.value: Allowed values are: 0 - 1.Assets, 2.Liabilities, 3.Income and Expenses 1 - 1.Assets, 2.Liabilities, 3.Income, 4.Expenses 2 - 1.Income, 2. Expenses, 3. Assets, 4.Liabilities 3 - 1.Income and Expenses, 2. Assets, 3.Liabilities 128 - Custom order. If the last option is selected, the order of accounts is determined by the COAOrder field of the individual Accounts. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RequireControlTotal
member.summary: Indicates whether the system must enforce validation of batch control totals on Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen.
member.value: When set to true the control total and debit/credit total of batches must match and user won't be able to save the batch until this condition is met. Otherwise, validation is performed only after clearing the Hold flag on the Batch. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RequireRefNbrForTaxEntry
member.summary: Indicates whether the Reference Number fields are required on Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen in case of entering Gl transactions with taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.PostClosedPeriods
member.summary: Determines whether the system allows to post transactions to closed Financial Periods. If set to false, the system raises an error on attempts to enter or post transactions into a closed period.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.BatchNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for batches.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.DocBatchNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for batches of documents created using the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.TBImportNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for imports of trial balances. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AllocationNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for allocations. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ScheduleNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for schedules. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.HoldEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system must set the Hold flag and Status On Hold when creating new batches.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.VouchersHoldEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system must set the Hold flag and Status On Hold when creating new vouchers.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ConsolSegmentId
member.summary: The identifier of the Segment of the Subaccount segmented key, whose values denote the consolidation unit in the subaccounts of the parent company. Controls the selector on the field.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.PerRetainTran
member.summary: Determines the number of periods the system will keep the transactions in the database.
member.value: Defaults to 99.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.DefaultSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the Subaccount to be used as the default one with Accounts, which have the NoSubDetail field set to true.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.TrialBalanceSign
member.summary: Determines whether the system should automatically change the sign of the trial balance when importing data. Also affects the way trial balance is displayed on reports and inquiries.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Normal - the system doesn't change the signs of balances of expense and income accounts on import. On reports and inquiries all the accounts are grouped by account type. "R" - Reversed - the system reverses the signs of balances of expense and income accounts on import. On reports and inquiries all the accounts except for the Year-to-Date Net Income account are listed. Defaults to "N".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ReuseRefNbrsInVouchers
member.summary: Determines whether the reference numbers for documents created on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form) are reused in case the number was allocated for the document that was not persisted, or the document was deleted thus freeing the reference number. When set to true, the system will pick up the free numbers from such documents when creating new entries on the mentioned form. (Note: this may lead to non-linear numbering.) Otherwise the form will always assign new numbers to the documents even if there are reusable ones.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.summary: Indicates whether the transaction has been posted.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.NonBillable
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the transaction is non-billable in the Project This means that when releasing the batch the system will set the field of the project transaction generated from this transaction to false. This field is relevant only if the Projects module has been activated and integrated with the General Ledger module.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.IsInterCompany
member.summary: When true, indicates that the transaction is an inter-branch transaction.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.SummPost
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must summarize the transaction with other ones when posting. In this case all transactions being posted are grouped by Account and Subaccount. Then, the amounts are summarized and a single transaction is created for each group.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.ZeroPost
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must post the transaction even if its amounts are equal to zero.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.OrigModule
member.summary: The module, to which the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by the parent batch of this transaction) belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.OrigLineNbr

member.value: Corresponds to the .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.OrigAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the associated with the original document. This field is populated for the transactions updating the account, which is different from the account of the original document. For example, if upon release of an Accounts Receivable document an RGOL account must be updated, the system will generate a transaction with set to the RGOL account and set to the Accounts Receivable account associated with the document being released.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.OrigSubID

member.summary: The type of the original document or transaction. This field is populated when a document is released in another module, such as Accounts Receivable or Accounts Payable. For example, when an ARInvoice is released, the system will set this field for the resulting transactions to the document's DocType.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.TranClass

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Ledger.PostInterCompany

member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Ledger.ConsolAllowed

member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.GL.AccountRules.IsGIRLSAccount(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the provided Account Type has Credit balance, that is belongs to the Gains, Income, Revenues, Liabilities and Stock-holder equity group. In Acumatica, Gains, Revenues and Stock-holder equity account types are not implemented.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.GL.AccountRules.IsDEALAccount(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the provided Account Type has Debit balance, that is belongs to the Dividends, Expenses, Assets and Losses group. In Acumatica, Dividends and Losses account types are not implemented.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.GL.JournalEntry.CleanupCreated(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Int32})
member.summary: Removes the last elements of the collection corresponding to GL batches that failed to persist. The absence of the batch index in the dictionary is used as a criterion. This method should be called each time the transaction scope is rolled back, immediately after it is rolled back.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the General Ledger module. When false, the period is active in GL.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Accounts Payable module. When false, the period is active in AP.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Accounts Receivable module. When false, the period is active in AR.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinPeriod.INClosed
member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Inventory module. When false, the period is active in IN.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinPeriod.CAClosed
member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Cash Management module. When false, the period is active in CA.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinPeriod.FAClosed
member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Fixed Assets module. When false, the period is active in FA.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinPeriod.PRClosed
member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Payroll module. When false, the period is active in PR. This field is relevant only if the Payroll feature is enabled.

member.summary: When true, indicates that the of the period is locked and can not be edited.
member.value: Note, that if the date is locked for a particular period, it is also impossible to change end dates for the preceding periods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinPeriod.Active
member.summary: Indicates whether the period is active.
member.value: Transactions can be posted only to active periods. In contrast, open but inactive periods can be used only for budgeting.

member.summary: The type of financial periods that make up the year.
member.value: Allowed values are: "MO" - Month, "BM" - Two Months, "QR" - Quarter, "WK" - Week, "BW" - Two Weeks, "FW" - Four Weeks, "DC" - Decade, "FF" - 4-4-5 Weeks, "FI" - 4-5-4 Weeks, "IF" - 5-4-4 Weeks, "CL" - Customer Periods Length, "CN" - Custom Number of Periods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.UserDefined
member.summary: The read-only field indicating whether the periods of the year can be modified by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.PeriodsStartDate
member.summary: The start date of the first period of the year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.HasAdjustmentPeriod
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system generates an additional period for posting adjustments. The adjustment period has the same start and end date and is the last period of the year. No date in the year corresponds to the adjustment period, so it can be selected for a particular document or batch only manually. See also the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.EndYearCalcMethod
member.summary: The method used to determine the end date of a year with week-long periods.
member.value: Available values are: "CA" - Last day of the financial year, "LD" - Include last selected day of week of the year, "ND" - Include selected day of week, nearest tot the end of the year. For more information on these options see the documentation for the Financial Year (GL.10.10.00) page of the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.EndYearDayOfWeek
member.summary: The day of the week when period starts. Relevant only for the period types based on weeks.
member.value: Allowed values are: 1 - "Sunday", 2 - "Monday", 3 - "Tuesday", 4 - "Wednesday", 5 - "Thursday", 6 - "Friday", 7 - "Saturday".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.YearLastDayOfWeek
member.summary: The day of the week of the last day of the financial year. Relevant ony for the period types based on weeks and if the is not "CA" - Last day of the financial year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.AdjustToPeriodStart
member.summary: When set to true, tells the system to align the start and end dates of the periods with the start and end dates of the corresponding calendar periods. Relevant only for Month ("MO"), Two Months ("BM") and Quarter ("QR") period types.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.BelongsToNextYear
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must set the financial year to the one, following the year of the selected start date of the year.
member.value: For example, if the selected start date is 10/28/2014 and this option is set to true, the will be 2015. If this option is set to false, for the same date will be 2014.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.IsFixedLengthPeriod
member.summary: When true, indicates that the length of the periods of the year in days is fixed. Read-only field.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.FPType
member.summary: Internal type of periods of the year. Read-only field.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field.

member.summary: The maximum rate variance allowed for manually entered exchange rates expressed as a percent. If the currency rate entered by user differs from the applicable currency rate stored in the system by more than the specified percent of the latter, and the field is set to true the system will display a warning.
member.value: Defaults to 0.0, which means that the checks for rate variance are disabled.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.CMSetup.RateVarianceWarn
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the system should display warnings about exceeding the allowed rate variance for manually entered currency rates.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.CMSetup.AutoPostOption
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the batches originating from the Currency Management module will be automatically posted to the General Ledger on release.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.summary: The identifier of the default type of translations performed in the system.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.CMSetup.RetainPeriodsNumber
member.summary: Defines for how many periods the translation records should be stored in the system.
member.value: Defaults to 99.

member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used to assign the reference numbers to the Translation History records.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Defaults to "TRANSLAT".

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyInfo
member.summary: Provides currency and exchange rate information used to convert amounts of a particular document or transaction between its currency and the base currency. Usually, there is an individual record of this type for each document or transaction, that involves amounts of money. The documents store a link to their instance of CurrencyInfo in the CuryInfoID field - e.g. . The exchange rate data for objects of this type is either entered by user or obtained from the records.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyInfo.BaseCalc
member.summary: When true, indicates that the system must calculate the amounts in the base currency for the related document or transaction. Otherwise the changes in the amounts expressed in the currency of the document won't result in an update to the amounts in base currency.
member.value: Defaults to true.

The records of this type are created and edited through the Subitems (IN.20.50.00) screen (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem
member.summary: Represents Stock Items (have value and stored in a warehouse) and Non-Stock Items (not kept in a warehouse and immediately available for purchase). Whether the item is Stock or Non-Stock is determined by the value of the field. The records of this type are created and edited through the Stock Items (IN.20.25.00) (corresponds to the graph) and the Non-Stock Items (IN.20.20.00) (corresponds to the graph) screens.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the record is selected for mass processing.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InventoryID
member.summary: Database identity. The unique identifier of the Inventory Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InventoryCD
member.summary: Key field. The user-friendly unique identifier of the Inventory Item. The structure of the identifier is determined by the INVENTORY Segmented Key.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StkItem
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that this item is a Stock Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Descr
member.summary: The description of the Inventory Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemClassID
member.summary: The identifier of the Item Class, to which the Inventory Item belongs. Item Classes provide default settings for items, which belong to them, and are used to group items.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemStatus
member.summary: The status of the Inventory Item.
member.value: Possible values are: "AC" - Active (can be used in inventory operations, such as issues and receipts), "NS" - No Sales (cannot be sold), "NP" - No Purchases (cannot be purchased), "NR" - No Request (cannot be used on requisition requests), "IN" - Inactive, "DE" - Marked for Deletion. Defaults to Active ("AC").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemType
member.summary: The type of the Inventory Item.
member.value: Possible values are: "F" - Finished Good (Stock Items only), "M" - Component Part (Stock Items only), "A" - Subassembly (Stock Items only), "N" - Non-Stock Item (a general type of Non-Stock Item), "L" - Labor (Non-Stock Items only), "S" - Service (Non-Stock Items only), "C" - Charge (Non-Stock Items only), "E" - Expense (Non-Stock Items only). Defaults to the Type associated with the Item Class of the item if it's specified, or to Finished Good ("F") otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ValMethod
member.summary: The method used for inventory valuation of the item (Stock Items only).
member.value: Allowed values are: "T" - Standard, "A" - Average, "F" - FIFO, "S" - Specific. Defaults to the Valuation Method associated with the Item Class of the item if it's specified, or to Standard ("T") otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the associated with the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Tax Category associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BaseUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the base unit for the Inventory Item.
member.value: Defaults to the Base Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.SalesUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the sales unit for the Inventory Item. This field can be changed only if the Multiple Units of Measure feature is enabled. Otherwise, the sales unit is assumed to be the same as the Base Unit.
member.value: Defaults to the Sales Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PurchaseUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the purchase unit for the Inventory Item. This field can be changed only if the Multiple Units of Measure feature is enabled. Otherwise, the purchase unit is assumed to be the same as the Base Unit.
member.value: Defaults to the Purchase Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PackSeparately
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the item must be packaged separately from other items. This field is automatically set to true if By Quantity is selected as the PackageOption. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PackageOption
member.summary: The option that governs the system in the process of determining the optimal set of boxes for the item on each sales order. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Manual, "W" - By Weight (the system will take into account the Max. Weight allowed for each box specififed for the item), "Q" - By Quantity (the system will take into account the Max. Quantity allowed for each box specififed for the item. With this option items of this kind are always packages separately from other items), "V" - By Weight and Volume (the system will take into account the Max. Weight and Max. Volume allowed for each box specififed for the item). Defaults to Manual ("M").

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SO.RefNbrAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized selector for SOOrder RefNbr.
By default, defines the following set of columns for the selector:
SOOrder.orderNbr,SOOrder.orderDate, SOOrder.customerID,
SOOrder.customerID_Customer_acctName, SOOrder.customerLocationID,
SOOrder.curyID, SOOrder.curyOrderTotal, SOOrder.status,SOOrder.invoiceNbr

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SO.NumberingAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SOOrder version of the
It defines how the new numbers are generated for the SO Order.
References SOOrder.orderDate fields of the document,
and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in SO Order Type: namely SOOrderType.orderNumberingID.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOInvoiceNbrAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SOInvoice version of the InvoiceNbrAttribute.
The main purpose of the attribute is poviding of the uniqueness of the RefNbr
amoung a set of documents of the specifyed types (for example, each RefNbr of the ARInvoice
the ARInvoices must be unique across all ARInvoices and AR Debit memos)
This may be useful, if user has configured a manual numberin for SOInvoices
or needs to create SOInvoice from another document (like SOOrder) allowing to type RefNbr
for the to-be-created Invoice manually. To store the numbers, system using ARInvoiceNbr table,
keyed uniquelly by DocType and RefNbr. A source document is linked to a number by NoteID.
Attributes checks a number for uniqueness on FieldVerifying and RowPersisting events.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SO version of the TaxAttribute.
Provides Tax calculation for SOLine, by default is attached to SOLine (details) and SOOrder (header)
Normally, should be placed on the TaxCategoryID field.
Internally, it uses SOOrder graphs, otherwise taxes are not calculated (tax calc Level is set to NoCalc).
As a result of this attribute work a set of SOTax tran related to each SOLine and to their parent will created
May be combined with other attrbibutes with similar type - for example, SOOpenTaxAttribute

member.name: M:PX.Objects.SO.SOTaxAttribute.RowUpdated(PX.Data.PXCache,PX.Data.PXRowUpdatedEventArgs)
member.summary: The purpose of this handler is to workaround situations where exception was thrown in RowUpdated event chain and formulas that are embedded inside SOTaxAttribute will fail to calculate totals. Resetting totals to null will force formulas to calculate on all the details rather then calculate on the difference from previous incorrect result.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOLineInventoryItemAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SOLine version of the CrossItemAttribute.
Providing an Inventory ID selector for the field, it allows also user
to select both InventoryID and SubItemID by typing AlternateID in the control
As a result, if user type a correct Alternate id, values for InventoryID, SubItemID,
and AlternateID fields in the row will be set.
In this attribute, InventoryItems with a status inactive, markedForDeletion,
noSale and noRequest are filtered out. It also fixes INPrimaryAlternateType parameter to CPN
This attribute may be used in combination with AlternativeItemAttribute on the AlternateID field of the row
[SOLineInventoryItem(Filterable = true)]
